subject.geographic: The Development of the Industrial United States (1870-1900).

mods.note: This pamphlet from an African-American school in Shelbyville, Tennessee, gives the purpose of the school as preparing the co-educational student population with a practical and useful education. It describes the building as well the absence policy, courses of study, and tuition. The President was James B. Eskridge.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
